# Templates

Templates, or page layouts, compose components within a single page. They provide structured layouts that combine multiple design components contextually, serving as reusable solutions for common VA.gov page scenarios.

## Form Templates

Templates for multi-step form experiences:

| Template | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| [Forms Overview](./forms/) | Introduction to form templates and the form journey |
| [How to Apply](./forms/how-to-apply) | Landing pages with eligibility and process info |
| [Introduction](./forms/introduction) | Form introduction pages that set expectations |
| [Form Step](./forms/form-step) | Standard form step pages for data collection |
| [Form Step - Minimal](./forms/form-step-minimal) | Simplified form pages with reduced header/footer |
| [Review](./forms/review) | Answer review before submission |
| [Confirmation](./forms/confirmation) | Submission confirmation with next steps |
| [Accessibility Guidelines](./forms/accessibility-guidelines) | Accessibility requirements for forms |

## When to Use Templates

Templates are appropriate for:

- Benefit applications requiring personal information collection
- Multi-step processes allowing progress saving
- Data collection with validation and error handling
- Authenticated experiences for information review and updates
- Standard VA.gov page types

## Core Design Principles

The framework emphasizes:

- **One thing per page** to reduce cognitive load
- **Progressive disclosure** showing only necessary content
- **Clear progress indicators** for multi-step processes
- **Automatic progress-saving** for authenticated users
- **Plain language** communication throughout
